intro: Ophiorrhiza valetonii, commonly known as the Malayan orchid vine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. Ophiorrhiza valetonii thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in tropical rainforests.
